data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, then you will always take 9 steps left. Likewise, if you always take 10 steps for and always face forward, you will always take 10 steps forward. If you always face left, then you will always take 9 steps left. Similarly, if you always face right, then you will always take 9 steps right. Similarly, if you always face left, then you will always take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.

If you take 4 steps, turn around, then you will turn around, turn right and return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Once you get back in your starting position, you can take a total of 10 steps. So, the answer is yes.

Turning right, you will step 1 away from the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Take 3 steps in each direction and after the first turn, you will take 9 steps in the direction you were in when you first started the direction you were in when you came to the starting point. Take 2 steps in each direction to go back to where you started. So, the answer is Yes.

Each time you have to face forward to take a step backward, take 4 steps forward. That’ s the sequence to taking a step backward. So, the answer is yes.

Always facing forward starts with a forward orientation. This leads the person to take 6 steps backward. This sets you back 1 step forward. This sets you back 5 steps left. This sets you back 2 steps left. This sets you back to starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

When you take 3 steps left, you are back in the beginning of the routine for those steps. When you take 1 step left, you are back away from the previous sequence and are forward again. So, the answer is yes.

If you face forward, you are resuming the order when your step is taken from first. 4 steps is a direction where you always face forward. 3 steps is the direction where you always face towards the right. Going right makes no sense for any direction but facing forward does. Thus, the answer is no.

You can return to the starting point by choosing any of the following strategies, each one of which takes a particular number of steps. To take the 10th step, you have to be right 4th, bottom left. If you’ re doing the last two strategies, both can be finished in eight steps. So, the answer is Yes.
